channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid jab rollout for 12 to 15-year-olds to start in schools in England
item.description: Parental consent will be sought for the programme for children aged 12 to 15, the government says.

item.title: Michael Barrymore pool death: Terry Lubbock 'gravely ill'
item.description: Terry Lubbock, whose son was found dead in Michael Barrymore's swimming pool, has terminal cancer.

item.title: Bristol man dies after crane carrying hot tub tips over
item.description: A man in his 70s was pronounced dead at the scene, Avon and Somerset Police says.

item.title: No sign of £4.8m golden toilet stolen from Blenheim Palace, two years on
item.description: The working 18-carat gold toilet called America was taken from Blenheim Palace.

item.title: Teenager charged with murder after woman's body found in Leicester
item.description: Leicestershire Police say Aaron Matthew, 18, is due to appear in court on Tuesday.

item.title: Liverpool star gives fan his kit after chance meeting while having X-rays
item.description: A "shocked" teenager met Liverpool's Harvey Elliott after they were both injured playing football.

item.title: Stonehenge: English Heritage to repair cracked lintels
item.description: The cracks and holes in the stone lintels of the 4,500-year-old stone circle are set to be repaired.

item.title: Preacher denies fraud over 'Covid protection' oil
item.description: Bishop Climate Wiseman is accused of selling £91 kits to help "cure or protect" people from Covid-19.

item.title: Vietnamese man arrested in people-smuggling investigation
item.description: Police say the man is suspected of being a high-ranking member of a people-smuggling network.

item.title: Refuse truck drivers poached on rounds
item.description: Five were poached by other companies amid a shortage of lorry drivers in the UK.

item.title: Appeal over WW2 medals found on Nottinghamshire golf course
item.description: Kimberley Farnsworth says it would be "absolutely incredible" to track down the owner's family.

item.title: Brexit and Covid take Liverpool pub's giant pork pies off menu
item.description: A pub could be without its giant pork pies for the first time in years due to delivery issues.

item.title: Coronavirus: Matlock Bath Illuminations return for 123rd year
item.description: The colourful event in Derbyshire sees hand-crafted boats parade along the River Derwent.

item.title: Suffolk school visited by Wattisham Airfield Apache helicopter
item.description: Pupils at Kersey Primary School are given a show and tell they will never forget.

item.title: Felixstowe arrival of largest container ship Ever Ace caught on drone
item.description: The aerial pictures show the Ever Ace coming in to dock at Felixstowe in Suffolk.

item.title: M25 climate protest: Aerials show long traffic queues as junctions blocked
item.description: Climate change protesters are demanding government action on home insulation.

item.title: 'I want the most independence I can get'
item.description: Evie, from Loughborough in Leicestershire, dreams of being a nursery nurse like her mum.

item.title: Plymouth gives Tom Daley Freedom of the City
item.description: Olympic diving champion Tom Daley is given the highest honour Plymouth City Council can bestow.

item.title: The Yorkshire Dales village still without TV reception
item.description: In the Yorkshire Dales village of East Witton, every aerial points to the broken transmitter.

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Medical equipment 'dumped' at bomb scene
item.description: Deployment of medical equipment "didn't quite reach our expectations", ambulance expert says.

item.title: Bristol masseur jailed for sexually assaulting clients
item.description: Callum Urquhart left the women feeling frightened and ashamed, the court heard.

item.title: Metrolink strikes to hit Manchester sporting events
item.description: A large majority of tram drivers vote against a 1% pay offer they describe as "pitiful".

item.title: Legal aid: Unscrupulous lawyers poaching clients, says judge
item.description: Bradford's top judge says defendants are being "tapped up" by rival solicitors for lucrative fees.

item.title: Raducanu: Christine Truman 'transported back' to her final
item.description: Britain's Christine Truman Janes reflects on her US Open final when she was also aged 18.

item.title: Grenfell Tower inquiry: Reckless firms showed neglect - lawyer
item.description: A QC representing many victims of the 2017 disaster strongly criticises several construction firms.

item.title: Carlisle 'monster' jailed for broken glass rape attempt
item.description: Dean Norman's victim said she feared she was going to be killed and was left feeling "devastated".

item.title: Beatles: Unheard John Lennon interview tapes up for auction
item.description: The Beatles legend speaks of his musical influences and how wife Yoko Ono changed his life.

item.title: Andros Townsend: Mum made me believe again by sending me goals video
item.description: Andros Townsend credits his mum for the wonder strike which helps Everton beat Burnley and continues their unbeaten start to the season.

item.title: Barker's 7-46 puts Hampshire on top against Notts
item.description: Keith Barker takes a career-best 7-46 as Hampshire take control against County Championship leaders Nottinghamshire.

item.title: County Championship: Yorkshire lose three wickets in bid to beat Warwickshire
item.description: Yorkshire lose England's Dawid Malan late on as their low-scoring contest with Warwickshire swings the Bears' way at Headingley.

item.title: County Championship: Lancashire take 14 Somerset wickets on day two
item.description: Lancashire are in command against Somerset after bowling them out for 90 and then taking further late wickets.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: US Open champion on resilience, celebrations and pleasing her parents
item.description: As Emma Raducanu basks in her new-found New York fame, she explains where she found the mental strength to win a Grand Slam title.
